languages.text: "Точнее — визжал, как и подобает забойному скоту. Тогда, на разоренном мире, где я часами коверкал его душу и разум". {n}Маражай тянет слова, медленно наступая на дознавателя.{/n} "Твой слуга торговался за избавление от боли самыми страшными секретами — твоими, Хейнрикс ван Калокс, и твоей маленькой мон-кайской Инквизиции. Нужны ли они мне были? Нет. То, что я хотел узнать, было неведомо твоему слуге — но он все не успокаивался, отчаянно пытаясь купить мое милосердие. Все бормотал и бормотал без устали — и о тебе, которого так боялся, и о своей обожаемой хозяйке... Лихтенхарт, не так ли?"

"No, he was squealing, like all cattle do at a slaughterhouse. Back on the ravaged world where I spent hours twisting his mind and spirit." {n}Marazhai draws out the words, slowly advancing toward the Interrogator.{/n} "Your servant traded away the most terrible secrets for a reprieve from pain. Yours, Heinrix van Calox, and those of your little mon-keigh Inquisition. Did I need them? No. What I wanted to know was beyond your servant's knowledge but he still would not settle down, desperate to purchase my mercy. He kept mumbling incessantly, both about you, whom he feared so much, and his beloved mistress... Lichtenhart, wasn't it?"
languages.original_text: "Точнее — визжал, как и подобает забойному скоту. Тогда, на разоренном мире, где я часами коверкал его душу и разум". {n}Маражай тянет слова, медленно наступая на дознавателя.{/n} "Твой слуга торговался за избавление от боли самыми страшными секретами — твоими, Хейнрикс ван Калокс, и твоей маленькой мон-кайской Инквизиции. Нужны ли они мне были? Нет. То, что я хотел узнать, было неведомо твоему слуге — но он все не успокаивался, отчаянно пытаясь купить мое милосердие. Все бормотал и бормотал без устали — и о тебе, которого так боялся, и о своей обожаемой хозяйке... Лихтенхарт, не так ли?"

traits.locale_text: "No, squealing, like all cattle do at the slaughterhouse. Back on the ravaged world where I spent hours twisting his mind and spirit." {n}Marazhai draws out the words, slowly advancing toward the Interrogator.{/n} "Your servant bargained the most terrible secrets for a reprieve from pain. Yours, Heinrix van Kalox, and those of your little mon-keigh Inquisition. Did I need them? No. What I wanted to know was beyond your servant's knowledge, but he still would not settle down, desperate to purchase my mercy. Mumbled and mumbled incessantly, both about you, whom he had feared so much, and his beloved mistress..... Lichtenhart, isn't it?"

He kept mumbling incessantly, both about you, whom he feared so much, and his beloved mistress... Lichtenhart, wasn't it?"
traits.speaker: MarazhaiCompanion

languages.text: « Rectification : il ne pleurait pas, il hurlait comme un animal à l'abattoir. J'ai passé des heures à tordre son âme et son esprit, sur cette planète ravagée... » {n}À mesure qu'il débite son discours, Marazhai se rapproche lentement de l'interrogateur.{/n} « Votre serviteur m'a divulgué de précieux secrets en échange de quelques instants de répit. Y compris les vôtres, Heinrix van Calox, ainsi que ceux de votre petit mon-keigh de l'Inquisition. Est-ce que j'avais besoin de les connaître ? Non. Votre serviteur ne disposait pas des informations qui m'intéressaient, mais il était si désespéré d'obtenir ma miséricorde qu'il ne parvenait pas à se taire. Il n'arrêtait pas de couiner, à propos de vous, son maître qu'il craignait tant, et de sa chère maîtresse... Lichtenhart, c'est bien ça ? »
languages.original_text: "No, he was squealing, like all cattle do at a slaughterhouse. Back on the ravaged world where I spent hours twisting his mind and spirit." {n}Marazhai draws out the words, slowly advancing toward the Interrogator.{/n} "Your servant traded away the most terrible secrets for a reprieve from pain. Yours, Heinrix van Calox, and those of your little mon-keigh Inquisition. Did I need them? No. What I wanted to know was beyond your servant's knowledge but he still would not settle down, desperate to purchase my mercy. He kept mumbling incessantly, both about you, whom he feared so much, and his beloved mistress... Lichtenhart, wasn't it?"

traits.locale_text: « Rectification : il ne pleurait pas, il hurlait comme un animal à l'abattoir. J'ai passé des heures à tordre son âme et son esprit, sur cette planète ravagée... » {n}À mesure qu'il débite son discours, Marazhai se rapproche lentement de l'interrogateur.{/n} « Votre serviteur a dévoilé des secrets précieux en échange de quelques instants de répit. Y compris les vôtres, Heinrix van Calox, ainsi que ceux de votre petit mon-keigh de l'Inquisition. Est-ce que j'avais besoin de les connaître ? Non. Votre serviteur ne disposait pas des informations qui m'intéressaient, mais il était si désespéré d'obtenir ma miséricorde qu'il ne parvenait pas à se taire. Il n'arrêtait pas de couiner, à propos de vous, son maître qu'il craignait tant, et de sa chère maîtresse... Lichtenhart, c'est bien ça ? »
traits.speaker: MarazhaiCompanion

languages.text: “不，确切地说，是尖叫，就像屠宰场里的畜生一样。在那个被蹂躏的世界里，我花了几个小时的时间，折磨他的思想和精神。”{n}玛拉斋一边说着，一边走向海因里希。{/n}“你的仆人愿意道出最可怕的秘密，只求我能给他个痛快。没错，你的仆人，海因里希·冯·卡洛克斯，还有你那小小的猴子审判庭。我需要这些秘密吗？并不需要。我想知道的事情，你的仆人并不知道，可他一股脑全都说了出来，拼命想要得到我的怜悯。他没完没了地念叨，说着你的事情，他实在是怕死你了。还念叨着她挚爱的女主人……是叫莱肯哈特，是吧？”
languages.original_text: "No, he was squealing, like all cattle do at a slaughterhouse. Back on the ravaged world where I spent hours twisting his mind and spirit." {n}Marazhai draws out the words, slowly advancing toward the Interrogator.{/n} "Your servant traded away the most terrible secrets for a reprieve from pain. Yours, Heinrix van Calox, and those of your little mon-keigh Inquisition. Did I need them? No. What I wanted to know was beyond your servant's knowledge but he still would not settle down, desperate to purchase my mercy. He kept mumbling incessantly, both about you, whom he feared so much, and his beloved mistress... Lichtenhart, wasn't it?"

traits.locale_text: “不，确切地说，是尖叫，就像屠宰场里的畜生一样。在那个被蹂躏的世界里，我花了几个小时的时间，折磨他的思想和精神。”{n}玛拉斋一边说着，一边走向海因里希。{/n}“你的仆人愿意说出最可怕的秘密，只希望我能给他个痛快。没错，你的仆人，海因里希·冯·卡洛克斯，还有你那小小的猴子审判庭。我需要这些秘密吗？并不需要。我想知道的事情，你的仆人并不知道，可他一股脑全都说了出来，拼命想要得到我的怜悯。他没完没了地念叨，说着你的事情，他实在是怕死你了。还念叨着她挚爱的女主人……是叫莱肯哈特，是吧？”
traits.speaker: MarazhaiCompanion

languages.text: 「いいや、屠殺場の家畜のような鳴き声だったな。残酷な世界を見せ、何時間もかけて思考と精神をいたぶってやったんだ」{n}マラズハイはそう述べると、ゆっくりとインテロゲイターに向かって前へ進んだ。{/n}「お前の従者は、苦痛から逃れるために、最も恐ろしい秘密を引き渡した。ハインリックス・ヴァン・カロックス。お前と、そしてお前の小賢しいモン＝ケイ異端審問庁の秘密をな。それは俺が知りたかったことではなかった。お前の従者は結局知らなかったが、それでも奴はうろたえ続けて俺に慈悲を乞おうと必死だった。奴はずっとブツブツつぶやいていたぜ。ひどく恐れていたお前のことや、奴の愛人のことも…。確かリヒテンハルトだったか？」
languages.original_text: "No, he was squealing, like all cattle do at a slaughterhouse. Back on the ravaged world where I spent hours twisting his mind and spirit." {n}Marazhai draws out the words, slowly advancing toward the Interrogator.{/n} "Your servant traded away the most terrible secrets for a reprieve from pain. Yours, Heinrix van Calox, and those of your little mon-keigh Inquisition. Did I need them? No. What I wanted to know was beyond your servant's knowledge but he still would not settle down, desperate to purchase my mercy. He kept mumbling incessantly, both about you, whom he feared so much, and his beloved mistress... Lichtenhart, wasn't it?"

traits.locale_text: 「いいや、屠殺場の家畜のような鳴き声だったな。残酷な世界を見せ、何時間もかけて思考と精神をいたぶってやったんだ」{n}マラズハイはそう述べると、ゆっくりとインテロゲイターに向かって前へ進んだ。{/n}「お前の従者は、苦痛から逃れるために、最も恐ろしい秘密を引き渡した。ハインリックス・ヴァン・カロックス。お前と、そしてお前の小賢しいモン＝ケイ異端審問庁の秘密をな。それは俺が知りたかったことではなかった。お前の従者は結局知らなかったが、それでも奴はうろたえ続けて俺に慈悲を乞おうと必死だった。奴はずっとブツブツつぶやいていたぜ。ひどく恐れていたお前のことや、奴の愛人のことも…。確かリヒテンハルトだったか？」
traits.speaker: MarazhaiCompanion

languages.text: "Nein, er hat gekreischt wie Vieh im Schlachthof. Auf der verwüsteten Welt, wo ich viele Stunden damit verbrachte, seinen Verstand und Geist zu verderben." {n}Marazhai zieht die Worte in die Länge und nähert sich dem Interrogator langsam.{/n} "Euer Diener gab die schrecklichsten Geheimnisse preis, nur um dem Schmerz kurz zu entkommen. Eurem, Heinrix van Calox, und dem Eurer kleinen Chem-Pan-Sey-Inquisition. Brauchte ich sie? Nein. Was ich wirklich wissen wollte, wusste Euer Diener nicht, aber er konnte sich trotzdem nicht beruhigen und versuchte verzweifelt, sich meine Gnade zu erkaufen. Ständig murmelte er etwas über Euch, da er Euch so fürchtete, und über seine geliebte Herrin ... Lichtenhart, nicht wahr?"
languages.original_text: "No, he was squealing, like all cattle do at a slaughterhouse. Back on the ravaged world where I spent hours twisting his mind and spirit." {n}Marazhai draws out the words, slowly advancing toward the Interrogator.{/n} "Your servant traded away the most terrible secrets for a reprieve from pain. Yours, Heinrix van Calox, and those of your little mon-keigh Inquisition. Did I need them? No. What I wanted to know was beyond your servant's knowledge but he still would not settle down, desperate to purchase my mercy. He kept mumbling incessantly, both about you, whom he feared so much, and his beloved mistress... Lichtenhart, wasn't it?"

traits.locale_text: "Nein, quieken, wie Vieh im Schlachthof. Auf der verwüsteten Welt, wo ich viele Stunden damit verbrachte, seinen Verstand und Geist zu verderben." {n}Marazhai zieht die Worte in die Länge und nähert sich dem Interrogator langsam.{/n} "Euer Diener gab die schrecklichsten Geheimnisse preis, nur um dem Schmerz kurz zu entkommen. Eure, Heinrix van Сalox, und die Eurer kleinen Chem-Pan-Sey-Inquisition. Brauchte ich sie? Nein. Was ich wirklich wissen wollte, wusste Euer Diener nicht, aber er konnte sich trotzdem nicht beruhigen und versuchte verzweifelt, sich meine Gnade zu erkaufen. Ständig murmelte er etwas über Euch, da er Euch so fürchtete, und über seine geliebte Herrin ... Lichtenhart heißt sie, oder?"
traits.speaker: MarazhaiCompanion

languages.text: «No, estaba chillando, como el ganado cuando va camino del matadero, allí en aquel mundo desolado donde pasé horas atormentando su mente y su espíritu». {n}Marazhai alarga las palabras, aproximándose lentamente al interrogador.{/n} «Tu sirviente me vendió los más terribles secretos a cambio de aplazar su dolor. Los tuyos, Heinrix van Calox, y los de tu ridícula Inquisición mon-keigh. ¿Y acaso los necesitaba yo? No. Lo que yo quería saber escapaba a los conocimientos de tu sirviente, y aun así no había forma de callarlo, tan desesperado estaba por mi clemencia. Farfullaba constantemente sobre ti, a quien tanto temía, y sobre su querida amante... ¿Lichtenhart, verdad?».
languages.original_text: "No, he was squealing, like all cattle do at a slaughterhouse. Back on the ravaged world where I spent hours twisting his mind and spirit." {n}Marazhai draws out the words, slowly advancing toward the Interrogator.{/n} "Your servant traded away the most terrible secrets for a reprieve from pain. Yours, Heinrix van Calox, and those of your little mon-keigh Inquisition. Did I need them? No. What I wanted to know was beyond your servant's knowledge but he still would not settle down, desperate to purchase my mercy. He kept mumbling incessantly, both about you, whom he feared so much, and his beloved mistress... Lichtenhart, wasn't it?"

traits.locale_text: «No, chillando, como el ganado cuando va camino del matadero, allí en aquel mundo desolado donde pasé horas atormentando su mente y su espíritu». {n}Marazhai alarga las palabras, aproximándose lentamente al interrogador.{/n} «Tu sirviente me ofreció los más terribles secretos a cambio de aplazar su dolor. Los tuyos, Heinrix van Сalox, y los de tu ridícula Inquisición mon-keigh. ¿Y acaso los necesitaba yo? No. Lo que yo quería saber escapaba a los conocimientos de tu sirviente, y aun así no había forma de callarlo, tan desesperado estaba por mi clemencia. Farfullaba constantemente sobre ti, a quien tanto temía, y sobre su querida amante... ¿Lichtenhart, era su nombre?».
traits.speaker: MarazhaiCompanion

languages.text: "Mezbahaya düşen diğer tüm kurbanlıklar gibi cıyak cıyak ağlıyordu. O harap dünyada, mon-keigh'in aklı ve ruhuyla saatlerce oynadım." {n}Marazhai, lafını uzata uzata konuşarak yavaşça Sorgucu'ya doğru ilerliyor.{/n} "Hizmetkârın, çekeceği acıyı birazcık erteleyebilmek için en büyük sırlarını anlattı. Senin sırlarını da anlattı Heinrix van Calox, o kıymetsiz mon-keigh Engizisyonu'nun sırlarını da. Bu sırlara ihtiyacım var mıydı? Yok canım. Asıl bilmek istediklerimi hizmetkârının bilmesi imkânsızdı. Yine de pes etmek bilmedi, merhamet edeyim diye her şeyi göze aldı. Bir şeyler geveleyip durdu... Senden çok korkuyormuş, bir de sevdiği bir hanım varmış... Lichtenhart mıydı, neydi?"
languages.original_text: "No, he was squealing, like all cattle do at a slaughterhouse. Back on the ravaged world where I spent hours twisting his mind and spirit." {n}Marazhai draws out the words, slowly advancing toward the Interrogator.{/n} "Your servant traded away the most terrible secrets for a reprieve from pain. Yours, Heinrix van Calox, and those of your little mon-keigh Inquisition. Did I need them? No. What I wanted to know was beyond your servant's knowledge but he still would not settle down, desperate to purchase my mercy. He kept mumbling incessantly, both about you, whom he feared so much, and his beloved mistress... Lichtenhart, wasn't it?"

traits.locale_text: "Mezbahaya düşen diğer tüm sığırlar gibi cıyak cıyak ağlıyordu. O harap olmuş dünyada, o mon-keighin aklı ve ruhuyla saatlerce oynadım." {n}Marazhai lafını uzata uzata konuşuyor, yavaşça Sorgucu'ya doğru ilerliyor.{/n} "Hizmetkârın, çekeceği acıyı birazcık erteleyebilmek için en büyük sırlarını anlattı. Senin sırlarını da anlattı Heinrix van Calox, o kıymetsiz mon-keigh Engizisyonu'nun sırlarını da. Bu sırlara ihtiyacım var mıydı? Yok canım. Asıl bilmek istediklerimi hizmetkârının bilmesi imkânsızdı. Yine de pes etmek bilmedi, merhamet edeyim diye her şeyi göze almıştı. Bir şeyler geveleyip durdu... Senden çok korkuyormuş; bir de sevdiği bir hanım varmış... Lichtenhart mıydı, neydi?"
traits.speaker: MarazhaiCompanion
